alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Lower Brewster County; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 14 at 1:48PM CDT until June 14 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the first Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 110. For the second Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 114 expected. * WHERE...Terrell, Central Brewster and Lower Brewster Counties. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, until 10 PM CDT this evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from noon to 9 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Central Brewster County; Lower Brewster County; Terrell
